poem:
Title: "Engulfed in Shadow"

To the jubilant, a melody,
To the wailing, a dirge.
The 26th, a heresy,
Bearing an uninvited urge. 
The nation's self-encore,
A spectacle accused of lies. 
Progressive reflections implore,
Will silence be the prize?
Amid frenzy, a moment's strife,
In the harsh truth contends,
The genesis of life,
On the solemn thread depends.
